modules.description: This module implements an HTTP server for handling GitHub webhook requests, providing functions to construct responses with custom headers, status codes, and body content. It supports operations like responding with strings, handling authentication challenges, redirects, and file resolution, while allowing low-level control through expert mode callbacks. The server processes incoming connections and routes requests to user-defined callbacks, enabling precise handling of webhook payloads and events.

This module implements a Unix-based GitHub webhook handler that manages repository subscriptions and event processing. It provides operations to create a webhook client, register repositories, specify event types, and handle incoming events asynchronously. Concrete use cases include building CI/CD systems that react to GitHub push or pull request events and automating repository management workflows.

Represents time values with support for minimum time comparison and retrieval of the current time. Works with time values to handle temporal data in event-driven contexts. Useful for tracking event timestamps and scheduling tasks based on time intervals.

This module provides a Unix-based system for handling GitHub webhook events with an integrated HTTP server, repository management, and time utilities. It supports registering repositories, specifying event types, and defining callbacks to process events like push or pull requests, while offering precise control over HTTP responses and time-based operations. You can build automated workflows that react to GitHub events, manage subscriptions, and handle temporal data for scheduling or timestamping. Example uses include CI/CD pipelines triggered by commits and repository automation tools responding to issues or releases.
